availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Martin (Jefferson County, KY, wholesale grocer & flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, grocer and wholesale flour dealer. Illinois native. Married to Elizabeth “Lizzie” Martin. Father of Charles Quirey Martin and Kate Martin. Partner in Phillips & Martin Wholesale Grocers with Henry G. Phillips in Louisville in 1859. Grocer in Louisville in 1860. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector. Grocer in Jefferson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 541.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 157, 183.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, 5th Congressional District, Jefferson County, Kentucky, June 1863, p. 88 (Accessed via ancestry.com on January 24, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Joseph Martin (unknown-1867)," Memorial #198287493, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/198287493/joseph-martin (accessed January 24, 2020).
KYR-0001-017-0163.
